history.content: Why don't you talk with Prof. Wagner or Prof. Popa in OH or email them, if you're in the class now? Or if you feel more comfortable approaching one of the TAs, maybe ask them for private chat about this? I'm in the class too and know that many of the TAs are involved with security research, just ask one of them and maybe they can either give you advice or help connect you with grad students or professors who they are working with!

children.subject: Ok yea I'll try looking into that. Thanks Ryan and thanks for such an awesome course!

Oops almost forgot! One thing I might recommend is looking at https://dare.berkeley.edu/ or URAP if you don't want to reach out to professors directly. I know more than a few people that have gotten research through those programs.

Per student answer, I would definitely recommend just doing some research into various security faculty on campus and reach out to those whose work seems most interesting to you. Depends on the professor, but many wouldn't care about how well you did in non-related classes as long as you're strong in the research area itself.

Glad you're enjoying the class so far! Feel free to reach out if you ever want to chat.

I also recommend checking out the security PIs at the International Computer Science Institute (ICSI) and the projects going on there! I felt really self conscious about grades when looking for research and applying for things as well, but my current research advisor framed it in a way that has stuck with me: if you never put yourself out there, then you’re guaranteeing that you won’t succeed—so give yourself a shot!


If you ever want to chat about research, feel free to send me an email or make a private post on the 161 Piazza, since a lot of our staff has some perspective. :)

history.content:
I am currently in CS 161 and I think this is the best course I've ever taken at Berkeley so far. Its such an interesting field, the lectures are really interesting, and all the concepts are cool. Its also the best I've ever performed in a CS class so far here. I really am interested in somehow continuing with research in the field, but I run into the problem that my GPA is not good.

I took a hard hit freshman year and first semester sophomore year I was hit with some personal problems that took a toll on me for half the semester. Im in a better position now and I expect my grades this semester to be relatively good and hopefully keep it for future semesters. I'm worried though that my GPA from the previous semesters will hinder my chance at getting into research.

Do I even have a chance of getting into research like this? I do have a lot of experience outside though with internships and leader ship positions in a STEM club if that helps
history.subject: How to get into Computer security research?
